definition: to work energetically for prosperity (of the country)
to exert oneself (bound form)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: We must work hard to raise to a new level the military and political quality of our army.
sentences.chinese: 要奮發圖強，把我軍的軍政素質提高到一個新的水平。

sentences.english: As for the wave is mediocre, and hard work is wise move.
sentences.chinese: 碌碌無爲是庸人所爲，奮發圖強是智者之舉。

sentences.english: Did it motivate or demotivate you?
sentences.chinese: 那將激勵你奮發圖強還是讓你變得消極厭世呢？

definition: to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to be strongly determined to succeed (idiom)
bold, visionary words
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
part work, part study/work-study program
honorable even in defeat (idiom)
to have boundless prospects
lit. ten thousand strings of cash in money belt (idiom); carrying lots of money/extremely wealthy/loaded
to respect the wise and venerate the worthy (idiom); to honor the great and the good
protective coloration/camouflage
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
stupid/slow on the uptake
young and vigorous (idiom)
